required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Diabetes Mellitus on Mortality of Patients With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Diabetes Mellitus on Mortality in Patients Hospitalized in the COVID Intensive Care Unit in the COVID-19 Pandemic

lead_sponsor.agency: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
The study includes patients over 18 years old who were hospitalized in our covid intensive care unit between March 16 and May 16, 2020.
Retrospective records were examined by examining the electronic data files of the patients.
Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests performed with nasopharyngeal swab taken from the person, which is the standard diagnostic method, and also the diagnosis of infection symptoms, risk factors and thoracic CT scans indicating pneumonia were diagnosed.
Patients over 18 years of age with and without a medical history of DM in their history were identified and compared in 2 groups.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study includes patients over 18 years old who were hospitalized in our covid intensive care unit between March 16 and May 16, 2020.
Retrospective records will be examined by examining the electronic data files of the patients.
Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests performed with nasopharyngeal swab taken from the person, which is the standard diagnostic method, and also the diagnosis of infection symptoms, risk factors and thoracic CT scans indicating pneumonia were diagnosed.
Patients over 18 years of age with and without a medical history of DM in their history will be identified and compared in 2 groups.
Demographic data such as age, gender, Body Mass Index (BMI) of all patients, presence of additional comorbid disease, blood glucose values during hospitalization in intensive care, ferritin, C-Reactive Protein (CRP), respiratory support methods (nasal oxygen, nasal high flow, non-invasive mechanical ventilation, intubation), length of stay in intensive care unit, and mortality will be recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: length of stay in intensive care
primary_outcome.description: The time between admission to intensive care unit and discharge

arm_group.description: Patients over the age of 18 with diabetes mellitus in intensive care unit
Patients over the age of 18 without diabetes mellitus in intensive care unit

study_pop.textblock: Patients over 18 years of age with and without a medical history of DM in their history will be identified and compared in 2 groups

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients over 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under 18 years of age

overall_official.affiliation: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Education and Training Hospital

facility.name: SisliHamidiye Etfal Education and Training Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital
